com.vorlonsoft.android.rate

Class AppRate

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vorlonsoft.android.rate.AppRate

  • public final class AppRate
extends Object

    AppRate Class - main class of the AndroidRate library, thread-safe and a fast singleton implementation.

    Since:
    0.0.4
    Version:
    1.2.1
    Author:
    Alexander Savin, Shintaro Katafuchi

    • Method Detail

      • with

        public static AppRate with(Context context)

      • showRateDialogIfMeetsConditions

        public static boolean showRateDialogIfMeetsConditions(Activity activity)

        Shows the Rate Dialog when conditions are met.

        Call this method at the end of your onCreate() method to determine whether to show the rate dialog or not. It will check if the conditions are met and show rate dialog if yes.

        Parameters:
        activity - your activity, use "this" in most cases

      • set365DayPeriodMaxNumberDialogLaunchTimes

        public AppRate set365DayPeriodMaxNumberDialogLaunchTimes(short dialogLaunchTimes)

        Sets the max number of occurrences of the display of the Rate Dialog within a 365-day period.

        Parameters:
        dialogLaunchTimes - the max number of the display of the Rate Dialog within a 365-day period, default is Short.MAX_VALUE, Short.MAX_VALUE means unlimited occurrences
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • setLaunchTimes

        public AppRate setLaunchTimes(byte appLaunchTimes)

        Sets the minimum number of launches until the rating dialog pops up for the first time.

        Parameters:
        appLaunchTimes - number of launches, default is 10, 3 means app is launched 3 or more times
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • setInstallDays

        public AppRate setInstallDays(byte installDate)

        Sets the minimal number of days until the Rating Dialog pops up for the first time.

        Parameters:
        installDate - number of days, default is 10, 0 means install day, 10 means app is launched 10 or more days later than installation
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        See Also:
        setTimeToWait(long, short)

      • setTimeToWait

        public AppRate setTimeToWait(@Time.TimeUnits
                             long timeUnit,
                             short timeUnitsNumber)

        Sets the minimal number of time units until the Rating Dialog pops up for the first time.

        Default is 10 days, 0 means install millisecond, 10 means app is launched 10 or more time units later than installation.

        Parameters:
        timeUnit - one of the values defined by Time.TimeUnits
        timeUnitsNumber - time units number
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        See Also:
        setInstallDays(byte), Time.TimeUnits

      • setRemindInterval

        public AppRate setRemindInterval(byte remindInterval)

        Sets the minimal number of days until the Rating Dialog pops up for the next time after neutral button clicked.

        Parameters:
        remindInterval - number of days, default is 1, 1 means app is launched 1 or more days after neutral button clicked
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        See Also:
        setRemindTimeToWait(long, short)

      • setRemindTimeToWait

        public AppRate setRemindTimeToWait(@Time.TimeUnits
                                   long timeUnit,
                                   short timeUnitsNumber)

        Sets the minimal number of time units until the Rating Dialog pops up for the next time after neutral button clicked.

        Default is 1 day, 1 means app is launched 1 or more time units after neutral button clicked.

        Parameters:
        timeUnit - one of the values defined by Time.TimeUnits
        timeUnitsNumber - time units number
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        See Also:
        setRemindInterval(byte), Time.TimeUnits

      • setRemindLaunchesNumber

        public AppRate setRemindLaunchesNumber(byte remindLaunchesNumber)

        Sets the minimal number of app's launches after neutral button clicked until the Rating Dialog pops up next time.

        Parameters:
        remindLaunchesNumber - number of app launches, default is 0, 1 means app is launched 1 or more times after neutral button clicked
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • clearRemindButtonClick

        public AppRate clearRemindButtonClick()

        Clears shared preferences that were set up by clicking the Remind Button.

        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • setMinimumEventCount

        public AppRate setMinimumEventCount(String eventName,
                                    short minimumCount)

      • setSelectedAppLaunches

        public AppRate setSelectedAppLaunches(byte selectedAppLaunches)

        Selects App launches.

        Method sets divisor for division of app launches with a remainder. This condition is satisfied if appLaunches % divisorAppLaunches == 0

        Parameters:
        selectedAppLaunches - default is 1, 1 means each launch, 2 means every 2nd launch, 3 means every 3rd launch, etc
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        Since:
        1.2.0

      • setRemindLaunchTimes

        public AppRate setRemindLaunchTimes(byte selectedAppLaunches)
        Deprecated. since 1.2.0, use setSelectedAppLaunches(byte) with the same param instead

        Selects App launches.

        Method sets divisor for division of app launches with a remainder. This condition is satisfied if appLaunches % divisorAppLaunches == 0

        Parameters:
        selectedAppLaunches - default is 1, 1 means each launch, 2 means every 2nd launch, 3 means every 3rd launch, etc
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        See Also:
        setSelectedAppLaunches(byte)

      • setShowLaterButton

        public AppRate setShowLaterButton(boolean isShowNeutralButton)

        Decides whether the Neutral button ("Remind me later") appears in the Rating Dialog or not.

        Parameters:
        isShowNeutralButton - default is true, true means to show the Neutral button
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • setShowNeverButton

        public AppRate setShowNeverButton(boolean isShowNeverButton)
        Decides if Never button appear in the rating dialog or not
        Parameters:
        isShowNeverButton - default is true
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

        Returns:

      • setCancelable

        public AppRate setCancelable(boolean cancelable)
        Sets whether the rating dialog is cancelable or not.
        Parameters:
        cancelable - default is false
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • setStoreType

        public AppRate setStoreType(@StoreType.StoreWithoutApplicationId
                            int storeType)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException

        Sets one of the app stores defined by StoreType.StoreWithoutApplicationId to the Positive button.

        Parameters:
        storeType - one of the values defined by StoreType.StoreWithoutApplicationId
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if storeType isn't defined by StoreType.StoreWithoutApplicationId
        See Also:
        setStoreType(int, long), setStoreType(String...), setStoreType(Intent...)

      • setStoreType

        public AppRate setStoreType(@StoreType.StoreWithApplicationId
                            int storeType,
                            long applicationId)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException

        Sets one of the app stores defined by StoreType.StoreWithApplicationId to the Positive button.

        Parameters:
        storeType - one of the values defined by StoreType.StoreWithApplicationId
        applicationId - application ID in the storeType app store
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if storeType isn't defined by StoreType.StoreWithApplicationId or by StoreType.StoreWithoutApplicationId
        See Also:
        setStoreType(int), setStoreType(String...), setStoreType(Intent...)

      • setStoreType

        public AppRate setStoreType(@NonNull
                            String... uris)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException

        Sets any other app store/stores to the Positive button.

        Parameters:
        uris - an RFC 2396-compliant URI or array of URIs to your app, e. g. https://otherstore.com/app?id=com.yourapp or otherstore://apps/com.yourapp
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if uris equals null
        See Also:
        setStoreType(int), setStoreType(int, long), setStoreType(Intent...)

      • getStoreType

        @StoreType.AnyStoreType
public int getStoreType()

        Gets the app store type from library options.

        NOTE: this method doesn't get an app store type from user's device.

        Returns:
        one of the values defined by StoreType.AnyStoreType

      • setStoreType

        public AppRate setStoreType(@NonNull
                            Intent... intents)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException

        Sets custom action to the Positive button.

        For example, you can open your custom RateActivity when the Positive button clicked.

        Parameters:
        intents - any custom intent or array of intents, first will be executed (startActivity(intents[0])), if first fails, second will be executed (startActivity(intents[1])), etc.
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if intents equals null
        See Also:
        setStoreType(int), setStoreType(int, long), setStoreType(String...)

      • incrementEventCount

        public AppRate incrementEventCount(String eventName)

      • setEventCountValue

        public AppRate setEventCountValue(String eventName,
                                  short countValue)

      • setThemeResId

        public AppRate setThemeResId(int themeResId)

        Sets dialog theme. You can use a specific theme to inflate the dialog.

        Parameters:
        themeResId - theme resource ID, default is 0
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • setDialogManagerFactory

        public AppRate setDialogManagerFactory(@Nullable
                                       DialogManager.Factory dialogManagerFactory)

        Sets DialogManager.Factory implementation.

        Call AppRate.with(this).setDialogManagerFactory(null) to set DefaultDialogManager.Factory implementation.

        Parameters:
        dialogManagerFactory - object of class that implements DialogManager.Factory, default is DefaultDialogManager.Factory class object
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • setVersionCodeCheck

        public AppRate setVersionCodeCheck(boolean isVersionCodeCheck)

        Sets the check whether the version code of the app is changed.

        Parameters:
        isVersionCodeCheck - true means to re-enable the Rate Dialog if a new version of app with different version code is installed, default is false
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • setVersionNameCheck

        public AppRate setVersionNameCheck(boolean isVersionNameCheck)

        Sets the check whether the version name of the app is changed.

        Parameters:
        isVersionNameCheck - true means to re-enable the Rate Dialog if a new version of app with different version name is installed, default is false
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object

      • monitor

        public void monitor()

        Monitors launches of the application.

        Call this method when the onCreate() of the app's launcher activity is launched.

        *

      • showRateDialog

        public void showRateDialog(Activity activity)

        Call this method directly if you want to force display of the Rate Dialog.

        Call it when some button presses on. Method also useful for testing purposes.

        Parameters:
        activity - your activity, use "this" in most cases

      • isShowingRateDialog

        public boolean isShowingRateDialog()

        Checks whether the Rate Dialog is currently showing.

        Returns:
        true if the Rate Dialog is currently showing, false otherwise.

      • dismissRateDialog

        public void dismissRateDialog()

        Dismisses Rate Dialog, removing it from the screen, and clears weak reference dialog object.

        This method can be invoked safely from any thread.

      • rateNow

        public void rateNow(Activity activity)

        Call this method directly if you want to send a user to rate your app right in the app store.

        Parameters:
        activity - your activity, use "this" in most cases

      • shouldShowRateDialog

        public boolean shouldShowRateDialog()
        Call this method to determine whether conditions to show the rate dialog meets or not.

      • isDebug

        public boolean isDebug()

        Checks if the library is in Debug mode. For development only!

        Returns:
        true if the library is in Debug mode, false otherwise

      • setDebug

        public AppRate setDebug(boolean isDebug)

        Debug mode. For development only!

        Setting the library to Debug mode ensures that the Rate Dialog will be shown each time the app is launched.

        Parameters:
        isDebug - default is false, true ensures that the Rate Dialog will be shown each time the app is launched
        Returns:
        the AppRate singleton object
